poem:
**Tourists in Rome**

In Rome's ancient veins,  
expectations meet reality—  
Emily's reel seems glossy.  
Sirtoli, sun-drenched, stands,  
cradled by stones of time.  
Her dream: scripted clean,  
yet dust swirls with stories,  
ancient breath,  
not quite packaged,  
but very much alive,  
beneath these footsteps—  
unwaxed, unworn,  
real as crumbling facades.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘They made Rome too clean’: fans of Emily in Paris on scenes in Italy Standing in the shadow of Rome’s most-famous monument, Gabriela Sirtoli, a tourist from Brazil, admitted that the Italian capital was not quite living up to her expectations. She had arrived one day earlier with her partner and their mothers, in part lured by the beguiling scenes of the city she had spotted in the series Emily in Paris. “When Emily started". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
